title: Reminder that fast food in Canada > fast food in America
body:
From McDonald's to KFC to Wendy's to A&W to everything else, fast food in Canada simply is of higher quality than the same thing in the States, barring human error when preparing the actual meals (if both meals are prepared properly, the Canadian one always wins).

This is because Canadian health standards are higher than American ones. For example, all Canadian chicken must not contain any growth hormones or any of that shit, but in the states I don't think that's the case. Even the cooking oil used by Canadian places is higher quality.

Seriously, I went to LA once and all the food I had there sucked. Everything from a Wendy's Baconator (which literally made me vomit several times) to spaghetti and meatballs, to California's famous In-n-Out, to random grocery store food. Everything I ate there was terrible.

What's the deal? How can Americans get so fat with food that tastes so awful?
